results.title: The Untouchables
results.creator_credit: Linson Films, Paramount Pictures, Art Linson and Brian De Palma
results.brief_description: Al Capone reigned as King in Prohibition Chicago, 1931. A team of determined government investigators, led by a young Federal Treasury agent is committed to bringing Capone to justice. Unbribable and incorruptible, they are “The Untouchables”. Kevin Costner stars as the legendary Eliot Ness in this bold action thriller by famed director Brian De Palma. Along with Costner, Sean Connery gives an award winning performance as tough beat cop Jimmy Malone, while Andy Garcia and Charles Martin Smith are the rest of the team. Robert De Niro is chilling as the sadistic but seductive Al Capone; a man who smiles when he kills.

results.title: The Unsinkable sea otter
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Undersea World of Jacques Cousteau”.
This shy sea mammal is fighting its way back to an ecological niche after two centuries of being hunted for its fur. But again the otter is under threat, both from abalone divers (who say it is destroying their supply) and from pollution of the coastal waters off Alaska and California. Suitable for upper primary and secondary levels.

results.title: The Unsinkable Molly Brown
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Lawrence Weingarten and Helen Deutsch
results.brief_description: Debbie Reynolds stars in her Oscar nominated performance as the eponymous Molly Brown. Destined for better things, Western orphan Molly leaves her mountain cabin and her uneducated and poor upbringing in search of a rich husband and a better life in Denver society. In a typical rags to riches fashion, Molly becomes the wealthiest woman in society. Based on the musical play with music and lyrics by Meredith Wilson. Screen play by Helen Deutsch. Cast includes Debbie Reynolds, Harve Presnell and Ed Begley.

results.title: The unsafe act
results.creator_credit: New South Wales. Dept. of Labour and Industry, Fortune Films and R.D. Hansen
results.brief_description:
This 1965 film dramatises a number of industrial accidents and how to avoid them. The film shows footage of workers in various occupations such as window cleaning, welding and bricklaying, and shows accidents that can occur in these environments. The dramatic voiceover warns against haste, improvisation, carelessness and failure to use safety devices, emphasising that most accidents occur in this way.

Produced by Fortune Films for the New South Wales Department of Labour and Industry.

There are several jumps in the soundtrack throughout the film due to missing frames.

Please note: As this is an archival work, the content does not reflect current practice or standards. Professional advice for up-to-date safety practices should be sought from the appropriate contemporary authority.

results.title: The Unreal image
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “One Pair of Eyes”.
Drawing on his knowledge of the Middle East to illustrate his theme, with part of the film shot in Britain and Greece also, David Holden, journalist and former Times Middle East correspondent, presents the argument that modern communications increase the fragmentation of the world by bombarding the individual with stultifying stereotyped images.

results.title: The Unquiet spirit: the life and art of Edgar Degas (1834-1917)
results.creator_credit: Ann Turner, RM Arts and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Phaidon art collection”.
Edgar Degas (1834-1917) was one the great French artists of the 19th Century. Often associated with the French impressionists, Degas set himself apart, preferring a studio practice studying human nature as opposed to ‘plain air’ paintings of landscape done by other impressionists of the time. This documentary examines the reputation and paradoxical personality of Degas in relation to society, his art career and life’s work and seeks to readdress this complex personality that too often was misrepresented during his lifetime. The sheer versatility and scope as an artist was not fully known until close to his death when a life’s worth of sculptures were revealed. Included throughout are examples of his drawings, paintings, prints and sculptures and picturesque views of France that serve to inform the atmosphere of Degas’s cultural environment. Obsessed with the great classical tradition it was Degas who took the study of the human figure towards modernism, able to articulate an intimacy of life that was both penetrating and shrewd. Written and narrated by David Thompson

results.title: The Unquiet peace
results.creator_credit: Philip Dorte, John Elliot and BBC Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode no. 14 of Series “War in the Air”
The story of British aviation in the years following the Second World War. An account is also given of international affairs such as the Berlin Airlift, the Korean War and NATO

results.title: The Unquiet land - civil war in England 1642-1646
results.brief_description: A detailed account of the Civil War of England in 1642-1646. Includes the division of the country prior to the Civil War through to the entrance of the Scots, the battle of Marston Moor and the final surrender of the King’s forces in 1646.

results.title: The Unpredictability of life...
results.creator_credit: ACMI, ACMI Digital Storytelling and Chris Villarroel
results.brief_description: When Chris Villarroel’s family were falling apart his home became his hell and he had no one to talk to. Eventually, Villarroel found solace and happiness in a new family.
